title: Like Michelle Pfeiffer, my midlife anger gets the better of me too
text:
My heart started to beat faster before I’d even seen the message on the familiar orange card pushed through my letter box this weekend.

“Sorry I missed you” wrote Yodel’s courier, by then presumably halfway back down the A1 with the parcel I had been waiting for. But they hadn’t. My husband, Chris, had been home – meaning either Yodel hadn’t knocked our door hard enough or Chris had ignored my specific request to listen out for our delivery (a bean bag, FYI).

Furious, I searched for Yodel’s complaints department on my phone. “What kind of service is this? It is a DISGRACE,” I roared at nobody in particular, interspersing my rage with Yodel with venomous looks at Chris, who I held equally accountable...
description: My heart started to beat faster before I’d even seen the message on the familiar orange card pushed through my letter box this weekend.
